page.title: 03Mendip Stores & Post Office.
page.content: When we went to visit this shop,one of the two largest in the village, we crossed the main road outside School and walked along the narrow pavement. We noticed a newly built wall as we came up to the left hand side of the Post Office. It was made from stone and not bricks. Hanging outside there is a special red and yellow sign saying Post Office. The building is blue and white, with a letter box in the side of the wall. The Post Office part is surrounded by special glass to protect the money. If someone smashes the glass it sets off an alarm. We could buy 8 different sorts of stamps if we wanted to. In the shop part there are three counters where you pay for things and 40 shelves of food to buy. A tin of Baked Beans costs 21p and a pink wafer biscuit is 14p.
